title: @Riot What's the plan with the Jungle item changes on the PBE?

embed.description: VERY WIP! ] [STATUS: PBE is currently offline.] The PBE has been updated! As we start the 8.4 PBE cycle, today's patch includes Dragon Master Swain and a new skin for Jarvan IV! Continue reading for more information!

body: All of the different smite upgrades have been replaced with this one item that combines the Blue Smite with the warding upgrade. There's a post about the AP items overhaul, but I haven't been able to find any explanation for this change even though it looks like a big deal.

replies.body: Very experimental, to the extent I'm a little surprised it's on the PBE already (hasn't really been tested internally at all yet either). A test into how much benefit there is from potentially streamlining the jungle item effects somewhat. Lot of varying opinions on it here.
Please don't let it come through, it removes a lot of jungle diversity (and there's already very little to start with!)

A lot of people are in a panic because they see it on the PBE and assume it's a preview of the coming patch. I think it would be better if you guys put experimental stuff on the PBE more often, then it would be more normal and people wouldn't overreact.

Tying the jungle ward to jungle mechanics is just nifty imo.

As someone who got up the ranks starting from the support role starting in like season 2 before branching out that sightstone on a jungle item never made sense to me. And even though the two smite variants had their [brief] moments I would just build the vision one without question. Except for maybe 2 of maybe the 6 times I played Volibear jungle. Why put up with a champion that needs an alternative.

Also avoids those awkward ah..hah no smite situations.

I'm a bit worried tho that people are just gonna abuse the new support quests for sightstones. Actually I'm pretty sure that's gonna happen really quickly.

Please don't release an item that seems designed specifically to ruin jungle eves main power spike time.

In fact if anything it buffs her since she took chilling smite anyways.

a {{item:2055}} provided by the item is strong especially since it has a good chance of preventing a gank / even getting eve killed, additionally if this jungle item change is added it might be good enough that ap based supports start regularly running smite just for the utility of a free control ward + on demand slow / ludens proc for harass.

Thats counterplay, not powerspike lol.
You used the wrong word.  Besides Eve is being buffed the same patch and she's already a top teir jungler.  So theyre giving her back her burst but giving more counterplay options.

More counter play options by allowing the jungler to basically have a constantly mobile pink ward? It refreshes on monster kills, which means that the Jungler can ALWAYS have a pink ward up where they need  to slap it down. Other classes don't have this luxury for such massive vision control (they have to pay for wards). This specifically neuters champions like Evelynn and Rengar, while also creating intense ganking potential with basically permanent control wards.

It refreshes on epic monster kills in the enemy jungle actually.  And it stores one charge.  Control wards dont neuter champs, the only time they did was when they disabled traps.  And the limit of one per person still applies.
Again this just adding counterplay, it doesnt actually nerf her.
That's a LOT of free counterplay, especially since Evelynn is one of the easiest junglers to counterjungle.

Ummm, no she's not.  Eve is a good dueler at low levels, counter jungling is generally a bad idea with her even for tanks since she deals percent health, she has great clear speeds and can burst buffs faster than almost anyone, while also avoiding damage with charm, in addition to her hp regen, and its still one coontrol ward which covers a finite area.  She can avoid or destroy it.  There's a reason she's been top teired since her rework.

It took a major nerf to her, and major buffs to others to knock her out of highest jungle win rate which she held for months, and she still only dropped to ninth place.

She's a really strong jungler giving counterplay vs her is not that terrible a thing.

She no longer deals %HP damage. That was nerfed out of her last patch. Additionally, her clears are still slower than a lot of other junglers (ESPECIALLY factoring in the wait she has to do for W to cook), and early game she suffers from a lot of mana issues. Most junglers like Lee Sin are significantly sturdier than her early game and can easily out duel her and escape. She may have been top tier, but it wasn't for her clear speed.

They didnt remove the %health, they lowered it by 2%.  And while she does have to wait for w(its not that long and the dmg per second is actually higher due to her burst), it deals as much if not more than smite early and disables the camps for a few seconds, letting her avoid damage and  with smite at about 7-8 she can almost two shot large monsters.
I never said she was sturdy, but her burst is top teir, she's not supposed to be sturdy she's an assassin.
Lee Sin is actually one of few people who _can_ out duel her early.

Her clear speeds are really good.

Pink smite sounds cool, but no jg items should be removed.  Item diversity seems to be decreasing, which really detracts from the game.  I've mentioned that the same thing applies to ADC as well, there isn't much build diversity, much less than junglers.

I think a lot of long time players will feel alienated if the game is oversimplified, which it seems to be progressing to.  Part of what makes League so appealing is it's strategic depth. 

Unfortunately, while the item aspect of the game revolves around building for each game, in practice the core items are always focused anyway, maybe change up the build order and have 1 or 2 items that are situational.

I know Riot wants to keep League fresh and exciting, but simplifying the game would have an adverse effect.

Back to jg items: I think red smite should definitely continue, but pink smite should be added.  If I recall correctly, there was also a grey smite once as well.

Of course, if pink smite is included, expect that to be almost the unanimous choice in LCS.

I'd love to see vision item options for all roles, especially since in solo queue mid laners and ADCs have to rely on their  teammates for vision, which is no guarantee.  I think many players at all levels would be happy to sacrifice some damage for vision.  And while tons of vision would seem to dilute the critical positioning of each ward, it would likewise increase the depth of counter vision strategy and make planning each objective or team fight attempt more imperative.

I hope to hear what others think about this!
